item.title: RT by @johnedenuk: #OtD 29 Jun 1890 libertarian socialist, Johanna Lahr, addressed a public meeting in Victoria Park, East London. Part of the Socialist League, she formed a bakers' union, and argued Parliament would one day be turned into a bakery!https://libcom.org/history/lahr-johanna-1867-1904

item.title:
RT by @johnedenuk: Had some time after work to visit this local exhibition. In light of @johnedenuk recent's articles on the racist 1978 killings in Hackney of Ishaque Ali & Michael Ferreira, was very thought provoking.

Ishaque Ali https://hackneyhistory.wordpress.com/2022/06/25/the-racist-killing-of-ishaque-ali-in-clapton-25-june-1978/

Michael Ferreira
https://hackneyhistory.wordpress.com/2022/01/06/who-killed-michael-ferreira-part-one/
item.dc:creator: @HackneyMuslims

item.title:
RT by @johnedenuk: Today is the 53rd anniversary of the Stonewall Rebellion. On this day, Black and brown street queens actively fought and protested police brutality against LGBTQ+ people and the police raids in gay bars. Pride started a year later to commemorate Stonewall. 

#PrideIsARiot
item.dc:creator: @AKPressDistro
item.description:
Today is the 53rd anniversary of the Stonewall Rebellion. On this day, Black and brown street queens actively fought and protested police brutality against LGBTQ+ people and the police raids in gay bars. Pride started a year later to commemorate Stonewall.

#PrideIsARiot

item.title: RT by @johnedenuk: Pedants of the world unite! Inaccuracies about #Sherwood from episode 5 was 1) That SDS officers had training (they didn't) and 2) that they went from being uniformed officers to undercovers (they were already Special Branch - so didn't wear uniform). #spycops
item.dc:creator: @bristolnoborder
item.description: Pedants of the world unite! Inaccuracies about #Sherwood from episode 5 was 1) That SDS officers had training (they didn't) and 2) that they went from being uniformed officers to undercovers (they were already Special Branch - so didn't wear uniform). #spycops

item.title: R to @HackneyMuslims: Thanks, I’m glad people read it. I agree - it’s worth remembering the bad alongside the good. And yes - hopefully past struggles can help with what we need to do today!
item.dc:creator: @johnedenuk

item.title: RT by @johnedenuk: This is a spoof post from a satirical account, but it's been true in the past - at least 3 #SpyCops really did go to #Glastonbury undercover at public expense. Mark Jenner in 1995, Mark Kennedy in 2007 & 2008, and Simon Wellings in 2009.
item.dc:creator: @copscampaign
item.description:
This is a spoof post from a satirical account, but it's been true in the past - at least 3 #SpyCops really did go to #Glastonbury undercover at public expense. Mark Jenner in 1995, Mark Kennedy in 2007 & 2008, and Simon Wellings in 2009.

item.title: "Crusties?" Chief Inspector Paul Botox squealed through a gobful of kebab. "Pah, rubbish! They died out years ago. So a handful of yobs used a crude incendiary device to bunk inside without paying. So what? It's hardly worth my while calling out the boys, we're far too busy!"
item.dc:creator: @johnedenuk
item.description:
